title: Argentina hits back over default as stock market slides â business live | Business | The Guardian
summary: argentina 's merval index falls 4 % in early trading .
argentina 's cabinet chief : we have not defaulted .
eurozone inflation rate drops to five-year low of 0.4 %
argentina ruled in default after talks fail .

documents.title: closing summary
text: time to recap .
argentina 's government has hit back after failing to agree a deal to avoid defaulting on a loan .
cabinet chief jorge capitanich blamed the incompetence of the us mediator handling its case , and claimed that argentina had not actually defaulted .

he declared : the credit rating agencies , the financial agents and opinionators who are trying to say that argentina is in a supposed technical default are playing an absurd hoax that is aimed at destroying the restructuring process of argentina debt .
capitanich urged argentina 's restructured creditors to demand their debt payment which has been frozen by a us court which rules that holdout ' creditors who must be repaid too .
argentina 's stock market has tumbled , down over 6 % , on a day in which all major markets have fallen .
fears over eurozone deflation and the impact of russian sanctions also spooked investors , on both sides of the atlantic .
the buenos aires stock exchange .
r. caivano/ap tomorrow , the isda trade body will rule on whether argentina 's failure to make its debt payment before last night 's deadline is a credit event ' .
that could trigged credit default swaps - insurance on the bonds .
judge thomas griesa , who has been hearing the case , has called a meeting for 11am est in new york tomorrow to discuss argentina 's recent default .
there 's also been speculation that investment banks could throw argentina a lifeline by buying bonds from the holdout ' creditors who have been demanding full payment .
jpmorgan has declined to comment on these reports ( which have been circulating for some time ) .
what the experts say the full consequences of argentina 's default are not yet clear , but several analysts have warned that its economy will be hit hard .

mohamed el-erian , chief economic adviser at allianz se , said the lawyers are the big winners : argentina will have a much harder time borrowing money on international markets , and will pay more to do so .
foreigners will be discouraged from making direct investments and argentines will be encouraged to take money out , further limiting the country 's growth potential .
irene mia of the economist intelligence unit fears that argentina 's currency could some under pressure .

the default could trigger market nervousness amid the government 's limited firepower to defend the peso ( international reserves totalled only us $ 29.7bn in mid july ) and an economy already in recession .
a 10 % or more peso depreciation is therefore a possibility , with knock out effect on inflation , real wages , interest rates and bank credit .

if this happen , we will revise our growth forecast for 2014 and 2015 downward significantly mark stefanini , litigator at international law firm mayer brown , predicts that the holdout creditors led by paul singer could make more vigorous efforts to track down argentina 's assets and seize them .
and the case has also reignited calls for a new mechanism for sovereign bankruptcies .
eric lecompte of jubilee usa network , argued : argentina never would have defaulted and hold-outs would have been forced to sit at the table if we had an international bankruptcy process in place .
in the coming months we 'll continue to see the g20 to the imf try to stop this extreme predatory behaviour .
our news story on the argentinian situation will be launched shortly , so keep watching the website .
good night .
gw

brindicci/reuters
joseph cotterill ( @ jsphctrl ) bring popcorn .
another sign of market nerves - the vix index , which tracks volatility in the markets , has hit a three month high .
wsj moneybeat ( @ wsjmoneybeat ) vix spikes 19 % to three-month high as fear creeps in to market via @ twitterid @ twitterid
argentina 's stock market remains deep in the red after its early plunge , down 6.2 % .
brazil 's market has also been hit , down 2.2 % so far today .
and the dow jones index has lost 238 points , or 1.4 % , to 16,640 .
bob pisani ( @ bobpisani ) what 's hurting markets : vitriolic ukraine rhetoric , @ twitterid warning ( citing russia ) , portugal , interest rate spike on u.s. data & argentina .

a newsflash from new york , regarding the meeting called for 11am est , or 4pm bst , tomorrow by judge griesa : us judge in argentina debt dispute says hearing set for friday morning is in regard to the recent default by the republic of argentina-court filing that suggests the court was n't persuaded by argentina 's argument that it has n't defaulted ( having been blocked from making yesterday 's payment )

documents.title: european markets fall
text: european stock markets have posted hefty losses tonight , as the global markets suffer a bad day .
shares have been dragged down by the argentinian default , but it 's not the only factor .
traders are also citing this morning 's disappointing eurozone inflation figures , and new fears over the russian crisis following a profit warning from adidas .
the espã­rito santo crisis also weighed on the markets - shares in banco espã­rito santo tumbled by 50 % after it posted a shock loss last night .
this helped to wipe 3 % off the portuguese stock market .
spain fell 2.1 % , closely followed by germany .
the french and italian markets both lost 1.5 % .
reuters the ftse 100 escaped with less damage , down 0.6 % .
analysts at etx capital explained : european markets fell on thursday following poor euro zone economic data , dissent at the federal reserve and ongoing weariness about sanctions on russia .
all major european benchmarks declined while us stocks also registered losses a day after the fed meeting in which policymakers continued to trim the bond buying programme .
elsewhere , the focus remains on possible developments regarding tougher new sanctions on russia by western powers .

the us might move to limit derivatives trading and short-term loans with russian companies if sanctions already imposed fail to persuade vladimir putin to end support for rebels in eastern ukraine , according to bloomberg .
already , there have been a number of harsh sanctions that threaten to cripple the russian economy , so markets are waiting for a response from putin .
all eyes are now on friday 's widely watched nonfarm payrolls data from the us .

documents.title: mohamed el-erian : many losers in this case
text: mohamed el-erian , one of the world 's best-known investors , has warned that almost everyone involved in the argentina default is a loser - except the lawyers , of course .
el-erian , the chief economic adviser at allianz se ( and formally of bond-trading giant pimco ) writes : argentina , as a nation , is the biggest loser .
it will have a much harder time borrowing money on international markets , and will pay more to do so .
foreigners will be discouraged from making direct investments and argentines will be encouraged to take money out , further limiting the country 's growth potential .
the country 's worsening economic and financial conditions are bad news for the government of president cristina fernã¡ndez de kirchner .

with their credibility already weakened by perceptions of incompetence and corruption , the authorities will find it even harder to govern a country that is operating well below its potential , undermining the well-being of both current and future generations of argentines .
but the vulture ' hedge funds are winners , right ?
not so much , el-erian reckons : yes , they took argentina to the brink and demonstrated their legal power and strategic smarts .
but their approach of forcing a generalized sovereign default could well reduce the net present value of their claims on argentina .
in the meantime , they will incur significant legal expenses on top of an already large bill .
more here : argentine default creates many losers
katia porzecanski ( @ katiaporzo ) jpmorgan talks with argentina holdouts said to be ongoing
there is a rumour circulating that jp morgan may be considering stepping in and buying the holdout ' bonds from paul singer 's nml capital .
if so , that could potentially resolve the impasse following last night 's technical default .
jp morgan , though , has declined to comment on the suggestion .
deals of this nature have been rumoured for a while , so best to treat with caution .
this story seems to have first emerged in the argentinian media earlier today .

in theory , banks could buy the debt and then do nothing until next year , when argentina 's pledge to its restructured creditors that it wo n't repay the holdouts in full will expire ( see earlier post ) .
business insider has a good take , here .
business insider ( @ businessinsider ) there 's a big rumor going around about how argentina can be rescued
holger zschaepitz ( @ schuldensuehner ) surfing # argentina .
official argentine peso drops by 0.2 % , informal peso slumps 4.4 % .
a reminder that the argentina stock market has performed very well this year : ransquawk ( @ ransquawk ) argentina 's merval index down 7.5 % but keep in mind the index has risen some 53 % ytd
the international swaps and derivatives association has apparently agreed to consider whether or not argentina has defaulted .
the isda panel will meet at 11am eastern time ( 4pm bst ) on friday - which is also when judge griesa will start holding his hearing on the case .
daniel cancel ( @ dancancel ) so we 'll have griesa hearing at same time isda panel decides whether cds will be paid out tomorrow at 11am in ny .
# argentina as explained earlier , isda will determine whether or not credit default swaps are triggered .
the vulture funds who brought the case against argentina are said to own large quantities of cdss
the argentina stock market has now slid by 6.8 % , wiping out almost all of yesterday 's rally , as investors react to last night 's developments .
here 's the biggest fallers on the merval index .
reuters
a fresh hearing to discuss the argentina situation has been called by judge thomas griesa , the man overseeing the case ( not terribly well , some say ) .

live squawk ( @ livesquawk ) u.s. judge overseeing argentina bond dispute schedules hearing for friday , august 1 at 11 a.m. edt says court official wsj markets ( @ wsjmarkets ) us district court judge thomas griesa overseeing # argentina dispute to hold hearing on friday | more to come :

documents.title: argentina 's merval index falls 4 % in early trading
text: shares are falling sharply on the argentinian stock market .
edenor , argentina 's largest energy provider , tumbled 12.5 % .
telecom argentina is down 9.5 % , and energy giant petrobras has fallen 7.6 % .
this has driven the merval index of major blue-chip companies down by 4 % in a rush of selling when trading began .
yesterday it had surged almost 7 % on hopes that a last-minute deal could be agreed that would have allowed argentina to make its bond payment .
peter hoskins ( @ peterhoskinssky ) # argentina 's benchmark merval share index slides 4 % in early trading after s & p said it had entered technical default over its debts .
the merval been one of the best performing indices this year , up around 60 % since the start of january .
bloomberg tv 's willem marx has been taking the temperature in buenos aires .
he reports that citizens sound thoroughly tired of the whole situation , while business owners are very worried that they will suffer a disastrous drop in investment .
and everyone 's having to think about the impact on the exchange rate and inflation .
willem marx ( @ willemmarx ) front page news : # argentina wo n't be extorted , and enters # default .
coming up on @ twitterid live from buenos aires
ouch .
the chicago pmi report , which measures business activity in the region , has just been released , and it 's much weaker than expected .
michael hewson ( @ mhewson cmc ) u.s. july mni chicago report business index at 52.6 vs 62.6 not a great signal for the us economy
good question raja korman ( @ rajakorman ) is argentina the first default ever caused by the inability to receive a willing payment rather than unwillingness or inability to pay ?
the dow jones industrial average has fallen by 121 points in early trading on wall street , down 0.7 % to 16759 .
the international swaps and derivatives association ( isda ) , a financial trade body , has been asked to rule on whether argentina has defaulted .
its decision ( which could take a few days ) will determine whether or not credit default swaps on argentina 's debt are triggered .
reinman mt ( @ reinman mt ) tough decision .

rt @ twitterid : isda receives request on whether credit event has occurred on # argentina cds daniel cancel ( @ dancancel ) isda asked to rule if argentina credit-default swaps triggered , 2,600 contracts outstanding for net notional $ 1 billion .
here 's an explanation of how isda 's panel works .
the cost of insuring argentina 's debt against default has soared today .
the cost of five-year credit default swap jumped to 1957 basis points , from around 1464 last night .
in practice , that means it would cost $ 1.957m per year to insure $ 10m of debt for five years .
some bond prices are falling too : bloomberg tv ( @ bloombergtv ) breaking : argentina 's 2038 dollar bonds fall 1.8 cents to 54.70
mark gongloff ( @ markgongloff ) argentina did n't `` fall '' into default .
it was pushed .

documents.title: argentina 's cabinet chief : we have not defaulted
text: over in buenos aires , cabinet minister jorge capitanich has denied that argentina is in technical default ( despite s & p 's ruling overnight , and the missed interest payment ) .
capitanich pointed out that argentina had tried to pay the money due to restructured creditors .
those funds are locked up at bank of new york mellon , who are barred by judge griesa from advancing the funds to the creditors .
capitanich has urged bondholders to demand their money , and claimed that the mediator - daniel pollack - was incompetent .
he also suggest argentina could take its case to the hague ( where the permanent court of arbitration is based ) .

here 's the snaps from reuters : argentina 's cabinet chief capitanich says government has no role to play in debt talks between private parties argentina 's cabinet chief says mediator pollack was incompetent argentina 's cabinet chief says bondholders have to demand money held up by judge argentina 's cabinet chief says argentina is not in technical default argentine cabinet chief says argentina is studying opening proceedings at the hague
argentina 's mining industry could struggle to attract investment for new projects , reckons analysts at city firm shore capital .
they write : we expect negative consequences for the argentinean economy ( notably higher inflation as a result of a weaker currency ) , albeit not as dire as the last time around .
we expect the country 's mining sector to suffer more , however , particularly those companies looking to raise funds with which to construct projects or explore the country 's rich deposits .

documents.title: larry elliott : we need a bankruptcy mechanism for countries like argentina
text: the decade-long battle between argentina and its creditors has highlighted a major flaw in the financial system the lack of a clear procedure for dealing with sovereign debt defaults .
one was proposed a decade ago by the international monetary fund ( they even cited paul singer 's fund as an aggressive creditor ) , but the plan did n't find favour with the us .
our economics editor , larry elliott , argues that policymakers must try again : the danger here is all too easy to see .
the legacy of the financial crisis of 2007-08 is that many countries find themselves saddled with big budget deficits .
in the event of another financial crisis , something that seems all too likely , there would be a wave of sovereign debt defaults .
is the international community prepared for this ?
clearly not .
the imperative , therefore , is for the imf to draw up a new blueprint for a sovereign debt mechanism and for the us to announce that it fully supports such a scheme .
more here : argentina 's second debt default could have been avoided

here 's our profile of paul singer , the hedge fund manager leading argentina 's holdout creditors ( when he 's not worrying that an electromagnetic pulse could destroy the world ) : profile : argentina 's nemesis , hedge fund manager paul singer

documents.title: on judge thomas griesa
text: a sign that reads in spanish yesterday braden or peron , today griesa or cristina in buenos aires , argentina , on tuesday .
r. caivano/ap one man , judge thomas griesa , has played a crucial role in argentina 's long battle with its creditors .
he 's been widely criticised for ruling that its holdout creditors deserved to be paid in full , making it harder for other countries to restructure their debts .
the ft has a good take .
here 's a flavour : judge griesa has for over a decade presided over various lawsuits against argentina by aggrieved creditors following its 2001 default .

most bondholders grudgingly accepted tough restructuring terms in 2005 and 2010 , but a handful of hedge funds led by paul singer 's elliott management have continued to pursue the argentina through the global legal system .
doing so has been difficult .
countries are both uniquely vulnerable and impregnable to irate creditors .

on one hand they do not enjoy the protection offered by a corporate or individual bankruptcy code , but it is virtually impossible to get hold of their assets as they are mostly covered by sovereign immunity .
but judge griesa blessed elliott 's novel interpretation of a centuries-old latin phrase most experts have dismissed as legal boilerplate , opening a chink in argentina 's armour .
he ruled that the pari passu clause meant that if buenos aires wanted to pay its restructured bondholders it had to pay elliott and its co-plaintiffs as well .

crucially , the octogenarian judge backed his ruling with a nuclear order - banning any financial institution with us ties from helping process argentina 's payment more here : no winners in argentina 's griefault debacle robin wigglesworth ( @ robinwigg ) no winners in argentina 's `` griefault '' debacle
kathy lien ( @ kathylienfx ) mkts taking argentina default in stride for 3 reasons 1 ) its a technical default 2 ) arg is more solvent than 2001 3 ) arg closed to capital mkts
france 's largest retailer , carrefour , is planning to pull back its expansion plans in argentina following the technical default , reuters reports .

documents.title: economist intelligence unit : peso could take a hit
text: irene mia of the economist intelligence unit fears that argentina 's currency could some under pressure .

she says : the default could trigger market nervousness amid the government 's limited firepower to defend the peso ( international reserves totalled only us $ 29.7bn in mid july ) and an economy already in recession .
a 10 % or more peso depreciation is therefore a possibility , with knock out effect on inflation , real wages , interest rates and bank credit .
if this happen , we will revise our growth forecast for 2014 and 2015 downward significantly mia also predicts that argentina will offer to swap its restructured bonds for new debt .

then it could keep repaying those creditors who agreed to take a cut after the 2001 default , and dodge the us court ruling that holdout creditors must be paid alongside everyone else ( as explained at 9.56am ) .
argentina 's economy minister axel kicillof .
honda/afp/getty images the news of argentina 's default could hit confidence on wall street .
the dow jones index is expected to fall 100 points , or around 0.6 % , when trading begins in just over three hours time .
jasper lawler of cmc markets says the argentina default is just another thorn in the side of confidence today .

a more hawkish fed , an argentine default and russian sanctions are taking their toll on investor confidence today , us markets closed mixed yesterday but look to open markedly lower today ahead more important earnings reports [ including oil giant exxon ] .

victoria fritz ( @ vfritznews ) sunny weather belies storm clouds gathering : s & p has argentina in selective default while europe 's inflation rate slips to a near 5 yr low victoria fritz ( @ vfritznews ) i was in argentina in jan during the currency devaluation & strikes .
many young adults leaving for ( they hope ) better prospects elsewhere

back to argentina and emiliano surballe , fixed income analyst at bank julius baer , says it 's not clear what will happen next : yesterday evening , the failure of negotiations between argentina and holdouts ' ( holders of defaulted debt whose claims were validated by a us court and have been due since late june ) sent the country into selective default .
bonds barely reacted to the news .
it is still not clear whether the credit default swap ( cds ) of the country will be triggered .
the situation that generated the default was a lawsuit , not the failure of the country to transfer the proceeds to pay existing debt .
there is a lot of uncertainty as to how the situation will be managed .
while the market is optimistic that a solution will be found in the next few days , execution risk is higher than that during the pre-default situation .
now , argentina might not only have to negotiate with holdouts , it might have to reach an agreement with the holders of sovereign debt that have just defaulted .
- insurance that pays out when a country defaults on a bond
alberto nardelli ( @ albertonardelli ) nearly 30 % of young people aged 15-29 in greece unemployed for longer than a year .
< 2 % in de , nl , lu , dk , swe , at , fi

the drop in eurozone inflation to a five-year low of just 0.4 % is a blow to the european central bank , says howard archer of ihs global insight : he writes : reinforcing the worrying news for the ecb , spain has moved back into deflation with consumer prices falling 0.3 % year-on-year in july .
furthermore , italy was on the brink of deflation as consumer prices were only flat year-on-year in july .

however , the ecb could take a little comfort from the fact that july 's dip in eurozone consumer price inflation was due entirely to a renewed year-on-year dip in energy prices ( down 1.0 % year-on-year after a marginal rise of 0.1 % in june ) and a slightly increased year-on-year fall in food , alcohol and tobacco prices ( down 0.3 % after a decline of 0.2 % in june ) .

documents.title: eurozone inflation rate drops to five-year low of 0.4 %
text: the eurozone economy has slipped further towards deflation territory , with inflation hitting its lowest level since the depths of the financial crisis .
the consumer prices index across the euro area has dropped to 0.4 % this month , statistics group eurostat reported , down from 0.5 % in june .
that 's the lowest rate since october 2009 , and a weaker reading than expected .
it piles even more pressure on the european central bank to stimulate the euro economy .
falling energy prices dragged down the inflation rate , and the cost of food , alcohol and tobacco also fell .
the price of manufactured goods was flat : eurozone inflation , july 2014 photograph : /eurostat core inflation , stripping out food and energy costs , was unchanged at just 0.8 % .

juergen baetz ( @ jbaetz ) # boom : # eurozone july # inflation rate fell further to 0.4 percent from 0.5 percent a month earlier - @ twitterid markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) eurozone # inflation at near 5-year low of 0.4 % in july

the unemployment rate across the wider european union fell to 10.2 % in june , the lowest rate since march 2012 : alberto nardelli ( @ albertonardelli ) eu unemployment rate : 10.2 % greece 27.3 % spain 24.5 % italy 12.3 % france 10.2 % poland 9.5 % uk 6.5 % germany 5.1 %

documents.title: eurozone unemployment rate drops to 11.5 %
text: breaking news in europe : the eurozone jobless rate has fallen to its lowest level in 21 months .
the overall unemployment rate across the euro area fell to 11.5 % in june from 11.6 % last month .
that 's the lowest rate recorded since september 2012 .
the lowest unemployment rates were recorded in austria ( 5.0 % ) , germany ( 5.1 % ) and malta ( 5.6 % ) , and the highest in greece ( 27.3 % in april 2014 ) and spain ( 24.5 % ) .
eu eurostat ( @ eu eurostat ) euro area unemployment rate at 11.5 % and eu at 10.2 % in june 2014 # eurostat europe 's jobless rate is still almost double that of america ( 6.1 % ) , though .
economist megan greene flags up that argentina could potentially do a deal with its other creditors - swapping their existing restructured debt for new bonds issued under local law .
that would allow argentina to circumvent the us court ruling that it can not pay the restructured bondholders unless it pays the holdouts too .
she writes : one option for argentina would be to default on its restructured bonds , offer to swap those bonds for new ones under argentine law andfree of us court rulingsgo on servicing them .
participation in this kind of bond exchange should be high since argentina will have already defaulted , and so the potential alternative for creditors would be to get nothing .
the great difficulty for countries that have undergone sovereign default is rebuilding their credibility in the markets so they might be able to borrow again .
under this kind of bond exchange , those participating would be getting paid as promised , so argentina would hardly lose credibility alessandro leipold ( @ aleipold ) .
@ economistmeg sums it up : `` sovereign debt restructurings will become more chaotic & litigious . ''
the # griefault mess .
argentina 's stock market could take a tumble when trading begins later today .
it had hit an all-time high last night , up 7 % , on hopes of a last-minute deal .
reuters brian joseph , head trader at local brokerage puente , told the wsj : the market reaction wo n't be positive there were big expectations of a deal .
this is n't good news .
the u.s.-traded shares of several prominent argentine financial services and energy firms fell wednesday in after-hours trading , with grupo financiero galicia diving 22 % .

stephen baines , bond investment manager at kames capital , agrees that the global markets are n't being rocked by the argentinian situation : stephen baines ( @ spbaines ) mainstream media excited by the entirely predictable argentina default .
financial markets completely ignoring it .

documents.title: the legal view
text: here 's some legal comment from mark stefanini , litigator at international law firm mayer brown argentina has elected to isolate itself from international capital markets rather than pay its holdout creditors .

it remains to be seen whether approaches such as a new bond swap for bonds governed by argentine law and jurisdiction will be attempted to enable argentina to avoid the full economic consequences of this decision .

argentina has chosen to avoid the risk of incurring further liability to restructured bondholders under the rights upon future offers ' ( rufo ) clause [ see previous post ] and to maintain its defiant resistance but in doing so , she faces economic consequences that are far more difficult to quantify .

in the face of this defiance , holdouts may well redouble their efforts to obtain access to argentine assets overseas using the additional discovery ordered by the supreme court on 16 june as a starting point resulting in further cases developing the sovereign immunity laws of relevant jurisdictions .
the holdout creditors , led by nml capital ( part of elliott capital ) , have already shown an appetite for chasing argentinian assets .
in 2012 , they forced an argentinian navy ship to be detained for 10 weeks in ghana .
argentina 's economy minister axel kicillof .
allegri/reuters these holdout hedge funds hold around $ 1.5bn of argentinian bonds which the country defaulted on in 2001 .
they mopped them up in the financial markets , at hefty discounts , after the default , and successfully persuaded a us judge that they should be repaid in full .
so why ca n't argentina just pay them off ?
the problem is that if buenos aires does settle in full , it would be forced to offer the same terms to the investors who agreed to restructure their bonds .
that clause is called rights upon future offers , and could potentially unleash $ 120bn of additional claims on argentina .
the wall street journal has pulled together a handy graph comparing argentina 's economy now and in 2001 , at the last default .
european stock markets have shaken off the argentinian default news .
the ftse 100 index of blue-chip shares is up 0.2 % in early trading , and the other major indices are steady too .
yesterday , argentina 's stock market surged almost 7 % on optimism that a last-minute compromise could be hammered out .
a religious debt relief group , jubilee usa network , has also condemned the funds who triggered argentina 's latest default by demanding full repayment .

eric lecompte , its executive director , argues that the world needs a better system to handle the fallout when a country ca n't repay its borrowings : because of the precedent this case sets there are a lot of losers and few winners .
legitimate investors and poor people lose the most .
argentina never would have defaulted and hold-outs would have been forced to sit at the table if we had an international bankruptcy process in place .
in the coming months we 'll continue to see the g20 to the imf try to stop this extreme predatory behavior .
sarah-jayne clifton , director of jubilee debt campaign , reckons argentina was right to resist paying the predatory vulture funds in full .
clifton says : thankfully this time the default is unlikely to have a serious impact on argentina .
its first default in 2001 actually kick-started economic recovery .
paying the vulture funds , on the other hand , would be genuinely disastrous , leading to billions of dollars in counter-claims from other holders of the debt .
this case will have a deeply troubling global impact , making it harder for countries across the world to resolve future debt crises .

documents.title: what will default mean for argentina ?
text: argentina 's last default , in late 2001 , came after a major political and economic crisis ; scores were killed in riots , and both the president and the economy minister resigned ( corrected ) this is n't expected to happen this time argentina remains solvent , and has the money to keep paying its other creditors ( it 's just not allowed to , unless it also pays the holdout bondholders in full ) but today 's default is still a blow to argentina 's economy , which fell into recession last month .
while the government itself is still locked out of the credit markets following the 2001 default , argentinian companies are likely to face higher borrowing costs .

as reuters puts it : even a short default will raise companies ' borrowing costs , pile more pressure on the peso , drain dwindling foreign reserves and fuel one of the world 's highest inflation rates .
robin bew of the economist intelligence unit also predicts further economic pain : robin bew ( @ robinbew ) # argentina defaults .
wo n't have immediate impact on economy but expect trade financing to be crimped , and recession further deepened

documents.title: argentina ruled in default after talks fail
text: axel kicillof , argentina 's economy minister , speaking to the media at the argentinean consulate in new york last night .
ruttle/ap good morning .
argentina has defaulted for the second time in 13 years .
last-ditch talks between finance minister axel kicillof and vulture bond holders failed to deliver a deal overnight , meaning argentina has been unable to meet payments to other creditors .
credit rating firm standard & poor 's has ruled that argentina was now in selective default .
at a dramatic press conference in new york , kicillof declared that argentina was n't prepared to be extorted by the holdout bondholders .
they are demanding to be paid in full on debt which argentina defaulted on in 2001 .

a defiant kicillof said : we 're not going to sign an agreement that jeopardizes the future of all argentines , argentines can remain calm because tomorrow will just be another day and the world will keep on spinning .
the default comes two months after a us court ruled that argentina must pay the holdouts in full ; even though other creditors had agreed to restructure their debts after the 2001 default .
shortly before the 5am bst deadline , daniel pollack , the court-appointed mediator confirmed that the talks had broken down .
pollack said : unfortunately , no agreement was reached and the republic of argentina will imminently be in default .
the world financial markets are not expected to panic this case has been running for years , so investors have been anticipating an argentinian default for some time .
however , default could prove painful for the argentinian people .
as pollack put it : the full consequences of default are not predictable , but they certainly are not positive .
i 'll be tracking the reaction to the argentina situation , and other news through the day

bulletin.text: Argentina's stock market tumbled 7% after it failed to hammer out a deal with its holdout creditors in time.
New Court meeting and credit event decision due on Friday.
Argentina blames mediator after time runs out.
Larry Elliott: Better sovereign bankruptcy rules needed.
Introduction: Second Argentinian default in 13 years.
